feature1.explanation: Both texts use punctuation marks consistently and similarly, including hyphens, colons, commas, and parentheses.

feature2.explanation: Text 1 uses more formal and structured language related to guidelines, while Text 2 is informal and includes slang. However, both texts show variation in word choice and part of speech usage.

feature3.explanation: Text 1 is more structured with clear sentences and coherence, while Text 2 has shorter, more fragmented sentences. Both texts vary in sentence length and complexity.

feature4.explanation: Text 1 is informative and directive in nature, while Text 2 expresses personal opinions informally. Both texts exhibit different narrative styles.

feature5.explanation: Both texts are free of spelling and typographical errors.

overall.explanation: Considering the commonalities and distinctions in punctuation style, lexical features, sentence structure, text discourse, and spelling, the likelihood of the two texts being written by the same author is moderate.
